result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: Case is Dismissed and read in to 21CT489 and 22CF429.

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

09:11 AM Defendant Mark F Froehlig in court with attorney Mark Kershek appearing as a friend to the court on this case.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Voge, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for Initial Appearance in this case.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Court sets a Signature bond with conditions.
Case is Dismissed and read in to 21CT489 and 22CF429.
Initial appearance on April 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:52 AM Defendant Mark F Froehlig not in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court notes the defendant is currently set for plea and sentencing on his other matters on April 25, 2022 at 9:00 am and further the defendant is represented by Attorney Mark Kershek.  The Court will adjourn the initial appearance date with the defendants other cases before the Trial Court.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
